newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Vienna stocks slip, support seen at 1,050.
newsitem.headline: Vienna stocks slip, support seen at 1,050.

text.p: 1315 GMT - Austrian shares end lower after trading most of the day marginally in negative territory.
Traders see market trading with a soft bias on Thursday ahead of the long weekend, and see support for the ATX at around 1,050 points.
* ATX index down 0.18 percent at 1,060.30 points.
* November ATX future down 15.9 points at 1,061.
* Top loser AMS, down 3.69 percent at 720.9 ahead of its nine-month earnings figures on Thursday.
* Leading gainer Mayr Melnhof, up 2.38 percent at 511.9.
Stocks in Vienna closed marginally lower on Wednesday on what traders said was largely technical selling.
"It looks as if we're going to continue with a soft bias," said one trader, adding "the next support is at 1,050 points on the ATX."
The ATX index of 21 blue chips lost 1.94 points, or 0.18 percent, to close at 1,060.30 after trading within a tight 1,056.91 to 1,064.42 points.
"From a technical point of view, the market lacks energy to push higher," said another trader, expecting a soft market tomorrow ahead of a long weekend.
The market will be closed on Friday for All Saints Day.
Of the ATX's constituents, 13 fell while eight gained.
The top loser was chip-maker AMS, shedding 3.69 percent to close at 720.9 schillings ahead of its nine-month earnings figures tomorrow.
"There're real shivers in the market over what comes out tomorrow from AMS," said one trader.
The day's leading gainer was carton board manufacturer Mayr Melnhof, up 2.38 percent at 511.9.
The all-share Vienna bourse index gained 0.07 points, or 0.02 percent, to 408.26.
The November ATX future fell 15.9 points to 1,061 on turnover of 1,746 contracts.
